column5: I read that Lake Simcoe whitefish are special subspecies. They are prized by some anglers. Are they prized because they are bigger than usual?
I'd say so there's a 14 lb er.  Hanging on the wall at the tackle shop at minuets point.
The average size of whitefish in Simcoe is pretty huge compared to just about everywhere else, that's for sure.
They're pretty big but you should see nip whities if you think simcoe whities are big!
Lots to eat compared to Haliburton  and Muskoka lakes.
i know nips herring can be big but I have never got a real big whitefish on nip simcoe humpback whitefish are big
There are no whitefish in simcoe!!
